title: Venezuela blocks Panama plane carrying senior politicians
content: A plane carrying former Latin American presidents ready to observe Venezuela's elections was grounded in Panama due to the blockade of Venezuelan airspace. The US warned Venezuelan President Maduro against interfering and hinted at adjusting sanctions based on the election outcome. Maduro, seeking a third term, faces strong opposition from Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia.
summary: A plane carrying former Latin American presidents ready to observe Venezuela's elections was grounded in Panama due to the blockade of Venezuelan airspace. The US warned Venezuelan President Maduro against interfering and hinted at adjusting sanctions based on the election outcome. Maduro, seeking a third term, faces strong opposition from Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia.

Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf organises rallies seeking release of jailed leader Imran Khan
content: The protests, organised at the provincial assembly level, saw local PTI lawmakers and leaders taking prominent roles in addressing the crowds. In Peshawar, demonstrations were conducted across all 13 provincial assembly constituencies, with a notable gathering in the Namak Mandi area led by Provincial Higher Education Minister Meena Khan Afridi.

US arrests drug godfather 'El Mayo': What’s next for Sinaloa cartel?
content: Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada’s arrest by US authorities signals a turbulent shift for Mexico's Sinaloa cartel. Experts anticipate increased violence as factions vie for power, while Zambada might reveal critical cartel operations. Mexican forces have bolstered security in response, and US officials stress the arrest's impact on drug trafficking. Strategic implications loom as cooperation potential arises.
summary: Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada’s arrest by US authorities signals a turbulent shift for Mexico's Sinaloa cartel. Experts anticipate increased violence as factions vie for power, while Zambada might reveal critical cartel operations. Mexican forces have bolstered security in response, and US officials stress the arrest's impact on drug trafficking. Strategic implications loom as cooperation potential arises.

title: 'The worst choice of all': Why some Republicans are questioning Trump's choice of JD Vance as Vice President
American support for female president falls: Report
content: A new Times/SAY24 poll by YouGov reveals a decline in American support for a female president, dropping nine points since 2015. The survey, conducted after President Biden exited the race, shows 54% of voters are ready for a woman president. Persistent gender bias remains, with 41% believing many wouldn't support an equally qualified woman over a man.
summary: A new Times/SAY24 poll by YouGov reveals a decline in American support for a female president, dropping nine points since 2015. The survey, conducted after President Biden exited the race, shows 54% of voters are ready for a woman president. Persistent gender bias remains, with 41% believing many wouldn't support an equally qualified woman over a man.

title: 'She was a bum': Trump attacks Harris, complains about Biden's exit in first appearance without ear bandage
World's first death from Oropouche virus: What we know so far
content: Brazil reported the world's first deaths from the Oropouche virus, transmitted by mosquitoes and midges, in Bahia. This virus, similar to dengue, has spread in South and Central Americas. It is not directly contagious and lacks specific treatments. Authorities are probing potential maternal transmission. Experts stress further research and readiness to prevent outbreaks.
summary: Brazil reported the world's first deaths from the Oropouche virus, transmitted by mosquitoes and midges, in Bahia. This virus, similar to dengue, has spread in South and Central Americas. It is not directly contagious and lacks specific treatments. Authorities are probing potential maternal transmission. Experts stress further research and readiness to prevent outbreaks.

title: Watch: Sunita Williams passes the torch as Nasa astronauts hold Summer Olympics in space
Who is Ronnie Stout? Ex-con arrested for starting California's largest wildfire
content: Ronnie Dean Stout II, a 42-year-old former convict, has been arrested for starting the Park Fire in California, now burning over 164,000 acres. Allegedly, Stout pushed a burning car into a gully at Bidwell Park, igniting the massive blaze. The fire, only 3% contained, led to widespread evacuations. Stout faces arson charges and potential life imprisonment under California's "Three Strikes" law.
summary: Ronnie Dean Stout II, a 42-year-old former convict, has been arrested for starting the Park Fire in California, now burning over 164,000 acres. Allegedly, Stout pushed a burning car into a gully at Bidwell Park, igniting the massive blaze. The fire, only 3% contained, led to widespread evacuations. Stout faces arson charges and potential life imprisonment under California's "Three Strikes" law.

FBI clears confusion: Bullet, not Shrapnel, struck Trump in July attack
content: The FBI confirmed that former President Donald Trump was struck by a bullet, not shrapnel or glass, during the July 13 assassination attempt at a Pennsylvania rally. This clarification follows weeks of conflicting reports and speculation. Trump and his allies, frustrated by earlier ambiguity, have sharply criticised the FBI and its Director, Christopher Wray.
summary: The FBI confirmed that former President Donald Trump was struck by a bullet, not shrapnel or glass, during the July 13 assassination attempt at a Pennsylvania rally. This clarification follows weeks of conflicting reports and speculation. Trump and his allies, frustrated by earlier ambiguity, have sharply criticised the FBI and its Director, Christopher Wray.

title: How US tricked and captured infamous Mexican drug lord 'El Mayo'
content: Ismael ‘El Mayo’ Zambada, co-founder of the Sinaloa Cartel, and his ally Joaquín Guzmán López were arrested in El Paso, Texas, in a dramatic capture involving deception. Zambada, a key cartel figure, faces multiple drug-related charges. His arrest marks a significant blow to organised crime and may lead to internal conflicts within the cartel.
summary: Ismael ‘El Mayo’ Zambada, co-founder of the Sinaloa Cartel, and his ally Joaquín Guzmán López were arrested in El Paso, Texas, in a dramatic capture involving deception. Zambada, a key cartel figure, faces multiple drug-related charges. His arrest marks a significant blow to organised crime and may lead to internal conflicts within the cartel.

title: 'I’ve got nothing against cats': How JD Vance defended 'childless cat ladies' remark amid backlash; Watch video
Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada, alleged Mexican kingpin, pleads not guilty to US charges
content: Ismael Zambada, the alleged co-founder of the Sinaloa Cartel, pleaded not guilty to US drug charges. He was arrested in Texas alongside Joaquin Guzman Lopez son of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman. Their arrest may impact Mexico's criminal landscape significantly. Zambada, known for his old-school tactics, contrasts with Guzman Lopez's flashier approach.
summary: Ismael Zambada, the alleged co-founder of the Sinaloa Cartel, pleaded not guilty to US drug charges. He was arrested in Texas alongside Joaquin Guzman Lopez son of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman. Their arrest may impact Mexico's criminal landscape significantly. Zambada, known for his old-school tactics, contrasts with Guzman Lopez's flashier approach.

title: Donald Trump vows to return to site of assassination attempt for 'big and beautiful' rally
content: Former US President Trump announced a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, where he survived an assassination attempt. Vice President Kamala Harris, endorsed by Barack Obama, concluded her campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination. Polls show Trump leading Harris by a narrow margin. The Obamas' endorsement could boost Harris' support and fundraising, potentially influencing her White House bid.
summary: Former US President Trump announced a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, where he survived an assassination attempt. Vice President Kamala Harris, endorsed by Barack Obama, concluded her campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination. Polls show Trump leading Harris by a narrow margin. The Obamas' endorsement could boost Harris' support and fundraising, potentially influencing her White House bid.
